page.title: 10 Cookhill Priory (cont.)
page.content: The farm covers an area of 100 acres which includes a Gazebo and an army burial ground.The army burial ground is a mound surrounded by a ditch and the Gazebo is a summer house where the monks who occupied the Priory would spend their Sunday afteroons as a kind of holiday.There is also a sundial which has been part of the Priory ever since it was built. Hidden in the ivy surrounding the house is a silver bell which dates from 1619 A.D.On the bell is written "William Fortescue August 9th Anno 1619." This shows that it was the personal property of the Fortescue family.In the south west corner of the garden is a garden house which dates from the 17th century.
